name: Foz Do Iguaçu
topics: Has 275 waterfalls across nearly 3 km
Taller than Niagara Falls
Borders Brazil and Argentina

description.scene_description: Nestled at the crossroads of Brazil and Argentina, Foz do Iguaçu is a spectacle of nature where roaring waterfalls dominate the horizon. This destination stirs awe in every visitor, inviting them to feel the sheer power and grandeur of one of Earth’s greatest wonders.

name: Gramado
topics: Hosts the famous Natal Luz Christmas festival.
Architecture inspired by German and Italian immigrants.
Known for chocolates and fondue.

description.scene_description: With its alpine charm and festive atmosphere, Gramado feels like a European village tucked into Brazil’s mountains. Whether in winter lights or chocolate-scented summer air, this town offers comfort, romance, and a touch of magic all year round..

name: Serra Do Rio Do Rastro
topics: Features over 250 sharp turns
Reaches over 1,400 meters in altitude
Often covered in fog, enhancing the mystique

description.scene_description: Few roads in the world compare to the winding paths of Serra do Rio do Rastro. Here, each curve reveals a new horizon of cliffs, forests, and clouds, making every drive an unforgettable journey through nature’s raw beauty

name: Vale Dos Vinhedos
topics: Birthplace of Brazilian wine
Offers wine tastings in family-owned vineyards
Scenic routes ideal for cycling and tours.

description.scene_description: In the rolling green valleys of Rio Grande do Sul, vineyards stretch across the hills in graceful rows. Vale dos Vinhedos invites you to slow down, sip fine wine, and enjoy a blend of tradition, taste, and stunning scenery.

name: Florianópolis
topics: Known as “Magic Island” due to local legends
Over 40 beaches on the island
Surfing hotspot, especially at Praia Mole.

description.scene_description: This island city, surrounded by waves and whispers of folklore, blends modern life with nature’s serenity. From surf-friendly beaches to quiet lagoons, Florianópolis is where culture and coastline live in perfect harmony..

name: Christ the Redeemer
topics: Voted one of the New Seven Wonders of the World
30 meters tall, arms span 28 meters
Weighs over 600 tons

description.scene_description: High above Rio de Janeiro, Christ the Redeemer opens his arms to the world. More than a statue, it’s a symbol of peace, faith, and the breathtaking beauty of Brazil’s most famous city.

name: Paraty
topics: Streets intentionally flood during high tide.
Preserved baroque architecture.
Hosts international literary and film festivals

description.scene_description: Walking through Paraty is like stepping back in time. Cobblestone streets lead to colonial churches, charming cafés, and the calm sea—perfect for those seeking both culture and calm.

name: Serra da Mantiqueira
topics: Home to Brazil's coldest towns
Ideal for hiking and ecotourism
Produces local cheeses and chocolates

description.scene_description: The misty mountains of Serra da Mantiqueira offer more than scenic views—they offer a deep breath of fresh air. Here, travelers find cozy inns, artisanal treats, and trails that wind through peaceful forested peaks.

name: Museum of Tomorrow
topics: Designed by Spanish architect Santiago Calatrava.
Runs on solar energy.
Focuses on sustainability and climate change.

description.scene_description: Set on the shores of Guanabara Bay, the Museum of Tomorrow is not just a building—it’s a bold question mark about our future. It mixes science, art, and technology to inspire curiosity and action.

name: Inhotim
topics: Combines botanical garden and art installations
Covers over 140 hectares.
Features works by renowned international artists.

description.scene_description: In the heart of Brazil, Inhotim breaks the mold of a traditional museum. Giant sculptures sit under open skies, tropical gardens cradle abstract art, and every path leads to discovery.

name: Pantanal
topics: Home to jaguars, capybaras, and caimans
Birdwatching paradise with over 650 species
Floods seasonally, creating rich biodiversity

description.scene_description: The Pantanal’s wild beauty stretches beyond the horizon. This vast wetland teems with life, from colorful birds to silent jaguars, offering one of the richest wildlife experiences on the planet.

name: Chapada dos Veadeiros
topics: Sits on an ancient quartz crystal bed
UNESCO World Heritage Site
Popular among spiritual travelers

description.scene_description: More than a destination, Chapada dos Veadeiros is a place to reconnect—with nature, energy, and yourself. Between waterfalls and canyons, the land seems to whisper ancient secrets.

name: Brasília Cathedral
topics: Shaped like hands reaching to the sky
16 concrete columns, each weighing 90 tons
Stained glass ceiling creates a glowing interior

description.scene_description: In the heart of Brazil’s capital rises a cathedral unlike any other. Light-filled and shaped like hands in prayer, it reflects the visionary spirit of a city born from bold ideas.

name: Emas National Park
topics: Known for bioluminescent beetles at night
Features cerrado (savanna) vegetation
Ideal for safaris and ecological tours

description.scene_description: Far from the city noise, Emas National Park offers silence, stars, and the subtle rhythm of the cerrado. Here, nature’s resilience is on full display—especially when the ground itself begins to glow at night.

name: Corumbá IV Lake
topics: Artificial lake created by a hydroelectric plant
Surrounded by preserved nature
Popular for jet-ski and fishing

description.scene_description: A peaceful retreat where blue waters meet green hills, Corumbá IV Lake is the perfect spot to rest, reflect, or set off on aquatic adventures with the sun overhead.

name: Meeting of the Waters
topics: Different temperature, speed, and density.
Flow together for 6 km before merging
Boat tours available daily.

description.scene_description: In the Amazon, two mighty rivers run side by side in a strange and silent dance. This natural wonder, where colors collide but never blend, leaves visitors in awe of the Amazon’s mysteries.

name: Tapajós National Forest
topics: Managed by local communities
Home to ancient trees and rare species
Offers eco-lodging and hiking

description.scene_description: Tapajós is a living classroom of the rainforest. Among towering trees and flowing streams, visitors explore the Amazon respectfully, learning from its roots—both natural and cultural.

name: Mount Roraima
topics: Inspiration for Pixar’s Up.
Flat-top plateau shrouded in mist.
Part of the Guiana Shield.

description.scene_description: With its flat summit hidden in clouds, Mount Roraima feels like something out of a dream. Mythical and majestic, it stands as a guardian of stories, legends, and prehistoric beauty.

name: Anavilhanas National Park
topics: Over 400 river islands.
Floods seasonally, changing the landscape.
Rich in pink river dolphins and exotic birds.

description.scene_description: Floating across the intricate maze of Anavilhanas feels like entering a world untouched. This immense river archipelago is a sanctuary of silence, wildlife, and wonder.

name: Amazon Theatre
topics: Built during the rubber boom era.
Features European materials like Italian marble.
Still hosts concerts and shows today.

description.scene_description: In the heart of the jungle, a piece of Europe still echoes in marble halls. The Amazon Theatre reminds visitors of Manaus’ golden past—and its vibrant artistic present.

name: Pelourinho
topics: UNESCO World Heritage Site
Colorful colonial houses and cobbled streets.
Cultural center for music and capoeira.

description.scene_description: Colorful facades, rhythmic drums, and the scent of acarajé in the air—Pelourinho is the soul of Salvador. It’s where Brazil’s African roots sing, dance, and proudly shine.

name: Lençóis Maranhenses
topics: Not a true desert—receives regular rain.
Best visited between June and August.
Can be explored by 4x4 or walking tours.

description.scene_description: This surreal desert of dunes and lagoons feels like another planet. Walking across Lençóis Maranhenses is a poetic experience, where silence meets sky and sand meets stars.

name: Jericoacoara
topics: No streetlights, preserving its charm
Known for wind sports like kitesurf.
Sunset watched from a famous dune.

description.scene_description: Tucked between dunes and sea, Jericoacoara is both secluded and alive. Days here unfold slowly—with kites in the sky, hammocks in the breeze, and sunsets that steal your breath.

name: Porto de Galinhas
topics: Crystal-clear natural pools at low tide.
Famous for colorful jangadas (rafts).
Once a center for sugar exports and slave trade.

description.scene_description: Porto de Galinhas charms with its clear natural pools, cheerful colors, and festive vibe. It’s a joyful beach escape where tradition meets tropical delight.

name: São Miguel do Gostoso
topics: Small fishing village with chill vibes.
Named after a local man nicknamed “Gostoso”.
Ideal for wind sports year-round.

description.scene_description: True to its name, São Miguel do Gostoso is simply delightful. With peaceful beaches and steady winds, it’s a perfect hideaway for rest, rhythm, and recharge.
